Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2008 04:11PM Justlin wrote: Annie,  I live in San Antonio--close enough??  However, as much as I would love to snack on some excellent chocolate, I agree that the drains need to stay in until your output drops.  I had my drains for 4 weeks, then the PS took them out as he felt I was being mutated by the antibiotics (long story). Anyway, he took them out even though I was still putting out 75 to 80 cc/day.  Now I have a suspected seroma ... which he probably drain tomorrow... so slow down as much as possible and hopefully you will be drain and seroma free soon! Lin
Posts.Title: REWARD! Box of CHOCOLATES! HeatherBLocklear AnneW

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2008 06:49PM Justlin wrote: I do not think having the healthy breast removed as well is too radical.  It is the option I have chosen, depite being told that I am "over reacting" and that this option is "overkill". Note that both of these remarks were made by well meaning male surgeons. I think that you should do whatever you feel most confident with.  No one can make this decison for you, and you are the one that must live with the decisiion - once made. Whatever you decide - the ladies of this board will offer support and encouragement.
